main.name: Palaash Kolhe
main.description: at the University of Waterloo. I like to design and program applications that solve problems I notice in the world around me
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.

resume.skillmessage: Some of my skills I have developed working on various projects over the years.

education.degree: Candidate for Bachelors in Software Engineering

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Performed the role of a Software Engineer Intern at Replit, an online integrated development environment which allows users to create online programming projects. There I worked with TypeScript and Go to drive 2 distinct projects (deployment suspensions and deployment rollbacks) from ideation to rollout, serving my work to 3000+ users.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Worked as a Software Engineer Intern at Adentro, a company that develops CRM software and tools. I utilized Go and Python to build logic to drive analytics and warehousing tools. I also assisted the team on the migration effort for MongoDB, upgrading 80+ files to the latest driver.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Performed the role of a Software Engineer Intern at Terrace, an institutional-grade trading platform for decentralized finance. There I worked with TypeScript and Go to tackle various challenges, such as implementing the A-star search algorithm to discover the shortest path between market outlets and leveraging external APIs to maintain current internal asset information.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Employed as a Software Engineer Intern at the game company, Zynga Inc., for my third co-op term. Placed on the Payments team where I learned all about how sensitive and critical teams operate. Worked with Spring, Angular.js, Jenkins, and other technologies to develop impactful features that directly affected revenue growth.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Employed as a Software Engineer Intern at the Ford Motor Company for my second co-op term. Worked with the Connectivity Dashboard and the Vehicle Health & Telemetry teams, both based in Michigan. I mainly worked with Java technologies such as Spring Boot and Micronaut, and received exposure to cloud services such as GCP and AWS through CI/CD pipelines.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Worked as a Software Engineer Intern at a fin-tech startup company based in Toronto. I leveraged technologies such as React.js, Node.js, MongoDB, etc. to create full-stack applications and further the company's mission to increase access to quality investment ideas and insights. Being my first internship, I learned a lot about technical standards and worked with many essential technologies.

projects.title: No Place for Hate
projects.category: A Chrome extension that harnesses AI to instantly detect and block online hate speech, promoting a safer and more inclusive browsing experience.

projects.title: DeFi Creditor
projects.category: A decentralized lending and borrowing platform that eliminates predatory interest rates by allowing users to set their own rates. Operates on the Ethereum blockchain, promoting financial inclusivity.

projects.title: MealDrop
projects.category: An innovative application that bridges the gap between surplus restaurant food and hunger relief organizations. MealDrop addresses food waste concerns and hunger by connecting food donors with those in need.
projects.technologies: MongoDB, Express, React.js, Node.js, Google Cloud Platform

projects.title: Shady Assistant
projects.category: A pair of smart glasses that translate foreign language text into English. Implements an OCR script to analyze text and translates with the Google Translate API.

projects.title: Cash Flow Management App
projects.category: An Android App that scans items in receipts using Firebase's OCR model to display spending habits. Categorizes this data and presents in the form of a pie chart.
projects.technologies: Java, Firebase, React Native, Machine Learning (OCR)

projects.title: Investing with Machine Learning
projects.category: A machine learning powered script that is trained off of stock data spanning all the way back to 2000 to label and predict whether a stock is worth buying.

projects.title: Stock Widget
projects.category: A widget that searches up any stock you want and scrapes relevant information such as live prices, change, dividend yield, etc.
